text: Hi, I am quite but not so new to Julia and was testing the performance improvement given by threading. Using `@threads` took a lot longer than running the loop normally. More description is given in the paste itself, please give it a check and let me know if I'm doing anything wrong. <https://paste.gg/p/anonymous/02300d2544b04e02ae9f098f26b3368f>

text: I image you ran `using Base.Threads` before the code
That is some odd behavior for sure. You might try running it from a REPL in your terminal and checking `Threads.nthreads()` . That is a very significant slowdown.

elements.text: That is some odd behavior for sure. You might try running it from a REPL in your terminal and checking
. That is a very significant slowdown.

text:
Running from the terminal REPL ran for ~6 ms all the time so it seems to be working fine through the terminal.
I tried again in Atom and the `@threads` only function ran for 3.8 ms just once and then went back to running at 5 secs..
So the problem could be somewhere in Atom when launching the threads?
